## Our Research

::: {.intro-text}
We are a research group spread across several schools at ANU, united by our interest in evolutionary and ecological processes underlying biological, linguistic and cultural diversity, and the conservation of biodiversity. Our research covers a wide range of questions, taxonomic groups and spatial scales. Our research themes include:
:::

::: {.research-themes}

::: {.theme-item}
{{< iconify mdi dna >}} Patterns and processes of molecular evolution
:::

::: {.theme-item}
{{< iconify mdi translate >}} Evolution of languages and linguistic diversity
:::

::: {.theme-item}
{{< iconify mdi source-branch >}} Phylogenetics, macroevolution and biogeography
:::

::: {.theme-item}
{{< iconify mdi shield-nature >}} Extinction risk and conservation prioritization
:::

:::
